content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Here is an example of how you can define such a method in Julia:

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits{T<:AbstractFloat}
    value::T
    unit::String
end

function Base.show(io::IO, fwu::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, "$(fwu.value) $(fwu.unit)")
end
```
This will define a `show` function that takes an IO stream and a FloatWithUnits object as input. It then prints the value of the FloatWithUnits object followed by a space and the unit.
